channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Check test coverage - add compile tests
Refactor the tests to use Test::More
item.description: As part of becomming a co-maintainer of Pod::Tree I have written a series of articles describing the process and published them for the Perl Maven Pro subscribers. It is time to re-publish them to the general public.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Hacking on Perl 6 (Rakudo and Roast)
item.description: It seems fixing a bug in Rakudo, the compiler of Perl 6, is actually fun.

item.title: Exploring Perl 6: Signatures, Part 2
item.description: Class constraints with and without a where block. Promising the type of the returned value. Introspection: How to find out about the constraints during run-time.

item.title: Christmas announcement, two.
item.description: Thanking the companies that supported the Rakudo Perl 6 effort.

item.title: Atom Perl6 editor tools
item.description: Tooling is critical for the success of a programming language. Having at least one great IDE supporting the language is very important. Ahmad, who was once one of the key contributors to the Padre project and who later went on and created Farabi, has now written a plugin for the Atom editor to support Perl 6.

item.title: Memory savings with cperl and AvSTATIC
item.description: 'B::C and cperl has now proper support for copy-on-grow (COG) and copy-on-write (COW) arrays.'

item.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: January 25th - February 1st
item.description: This is the place of the summary of the summary.

item.title: Perl 6 Release Goals: Final Grant Report
Perl 5 Grant Application: QA Hackathon Travel
item.description: The annual grant request of Ricardo Signes, the Pumpkin to attend the QA Hackathon.

item.title: Ian Hague Perl 6 Grant Application: JavaScript backend for Rakudo
item.description: Would you like to be able to run Perl 6 in a web browser near you? (sort of). Would you like The Perl Foundation to support it financially.

item.title: Hacker Public Radio Interviews Perl Devs @FOSDEM
Get an in-browser remote desktop with Mojolicious and noVNC
item.description: How to play Minesweeper on your home computer while you are at work?

item.title: Deserialization in Perl v5.8
item.description: It is interesting to see how to exploit a bug in an ancient version of perl, though I wonder, if the fix isn't available by just upgrading perl? See also Reddit. Though given the fact that the vulnerable code that does not use strict or warnings, I am not surprised the author uses such an old version of Perl.

item.title: Last call for review of Test-Builder using Test2 (Formerly Test-Stream).
item.description: 'It seems that declaring something done is the best way to find out ways in which it is not actually done.'

item.title: A parallel MongoDB client with Perl and fork
item.description: Connect to MongoDB; fork; reconnect in each child; do your job.

item.title: My Github dashboard of neglect
item.description: It is very frustrating when you submit a pull-request and noone responds to it for a year. It is also very embarrassing when you realize you were the one who did not respond to a pull-request. Now, with the help of a little Perl script written by David you can see the whole list of repos where there are pull-requests waiting for your attention.

item.title: CPAN Weekly: one module per week, in your inbox
item.description: It seems Neil does not have enough fun editing the Perl Weekly once every 3 weeks or so. Nor does he have enough on his plate running the CPAN Pull Request Challenge for a second time, and being in the river cleaning business up to his neck. Now he also wants to run his own weekly newsletter called CPAN Weekly giving you one CPAN module every week. I can only guess that he is looking for more ways to procrastinate... Good luck!

item.title: Rakudo Star Release 2016.01
item.description: As you might know Rakudo is 'just' the Perl 6 compiler and Rakudo Star is the name of the distribution that includes the compiler, documentation, and a bunch of additional modules. This is the first such release since Perl 6 was officially released. It also comes with a Windows MSI Installers.

item.title: #237 - CPAN Weekly
item.description:
Hi there!

I hope you've enjoyed your weekend. Rested enough to tackle the next week.

I am personally very excited, because I am going to run a seminar on testing with plenty of hands-on exercises using the real code-base of the client. This is a format I enjoy even more than using my own home-made exercises, because this ties in directly to their pain points.

In other news: there is a new weekly in town!

Enjoy your week and your weeklies!
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
